topic.prompt: Describe what breakfast might look like if humans lived underwater.

messages.text: Omg I was actually just thinking about this the other day while working on my research paper! So like, imagine instead of a kitchen table we'd probably have these floating platforms anchored to our sea-floor homes?
I feel like breakfast would be way different - maybe like, seaweed wraps instead of toast? And instead of coffee we'd probably have some kind of energizing like kelp juice or something
Actually reminds me of this sushi place I went to last month where everything was ocean-themed... except we weren't actually underwater lol
What do you think breakfast would be like? I'm curious to hear your take!
Wait that would make a lot of sense with the seaweed theme! I love seaweed so much
The sushi place sounds super cool!
I think breakfast would probably be a lot less toast / carb-y stuff, since those tend to get soggy and stale when moist

Oh same! I've been really into those seaweed snacks lately - way healthier than chips lol. Speaking of underwater breakfast though, I feel like we'd probably have these cool like... water-proof heating pods? Instead of a stove?
Like imagine trying to fry an egg underwater lol That would be wild. Though I guess technically we wouldn't even have regular eggs - probably some kind of fish roe situation instead

That sushi place I mentioned had these really cool floating serving boats - kinda makes me think that's how we'd actually eat underwater. Everything would just... float to you? No need for passing dishes around the table haha

reason: The messages are similar to how [REDACTED] talks, but I'm unsure about the flow of conversation. The conversation feels very organized (point - to - point - to - point, then conclusion) compared to how my normal texts feel.
